title: Condor Liberation: Safe, stable and 'well built' | Channel
text:
An independent report into the safety of Condor's Liberation ferry has found the vessel is 'well built and suited to operating in the English Channel'.
The assessment follows a series of problems with the boat which caused significant disruption to sailings last month.
However the report, by independent engineering company Houlder Ltd, puts it down to 'teething problems'.
Some teething problems are expected with any new vessel, these issues are affecting punctuality. There have only been three days when the vessel has not sailed due to engine issues.
– Houlder Ltd The company did find the ship experienced occassional 'roll motions', caused by large waves, which can affect customer comfort.
Condor has said it welcomes the findings and is determined to making the recommended improvements.
Whilst these don’t affect the ship’s safety, we know they are disconcerting to customers, and so we’ll be doing all we can to minimise the likelihood of them occurring as well as improving communications on board when they do occur.
– Captain Fran Collins, Condor Ferries Last updated Fri 16 Oct 2015 Read more 1 update Independent report into Condor Liberation Travel Guernsey Jersey
